intro: Marsupiaria valenzuelana, commonly known as the Valenzuelan waxplant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive waxy, glandular leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species in its native habitat.
